intro: Cavendishia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican Cavendish, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences that can range in color from red to orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
